subject: Technology
title: TV Advertising: How Commercials Shaped Culture
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on TV Advertising: How Commercials Shaped Culture.

hook.text: The first TV commercial aired in 1941. It was 10 seconds for a watch company and cost $9. Today's ads cost millions.

buildup.text: Early sponsors controlled entire shows. Texaco Star Theater and Kraft Television Theatre were named after their sponsors.

discovery.text: Commercials created cultural icons: the Marlboro Man, Tony the Tiger, and the Energizer Bunny are all TV ad creations.

twist.text: DVRs let viewers skip commercials. The ad industry panicked. Product placement inside shows became the workaround.

climax.text: Streaming platforms offer ad-free tiers for a premium. The question is whether viewers will pay to avoid interruption.

punchline.text: Free TV was never free. You paid with your attention.

quiz.question: How much did the first TV commercial cost in 1941?
